unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically assess a companyâ€™s historical financial performance using financial ratios and other analysis tools.
Apply financial analysis skills to develop financial projections for a project or business.
Prepare and explain the interrelationships between the three major financial statements.
Construct and demonstrate proficiency in using spreadsheet based integrated financial models to solve a range of finance based problems.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Readings and research guided by tasks included in online module.

assessments.description: Analysis of an individual case study topic and presentation of conclusions : 2,500 words
3-hour online exam on all topics covered during the session.
Two online quizzes will be conducted during the session.
Four short exercises, each assessing a different topic.

data.subject_search_title: AFCX6019 - Financial Statement Analysis and Modelling
data.description: This unit equips students with financial analysis skills to support advanced study in corporate finance and investment analysis. Emphasis is placed on being able to interpret financial statements in the context of a company's operational performance and strategy, to assess historical financial performance and to prepare a spreadsheet based financial model capable of forecasting integrated financial statements for a company. After this unit, students should understand the language of financial statements, and be able to use an Annual Report to develop an understanding of a company's historical performance and prospects. Specific topics include the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow Statement and financial statement analysis using Dupont methodology. Financial modelling applications will also be developed, so students will be able to prepare forecasts for the three financial statements, as well as being able to integrate the three statements.
data.search_title: AFCX6019 - Financial Statement Analysis and Modelling
